radiographic_examinations.findings: Absence of bowel gas in the midabdomen and peripheral displacement of multiple bowel loops, suggestive of an abdominal mass; no free intra-peritoneal air or abnormal calcifications.

A large, thick-walled complex cystic mass in the midabdomen, predominantly to the left of the midline, displacing the left kidney laterally, with internal dependent debris and multiple mural satellite cysts; no internal vascularity on Doppler imaging.

A complex cystic mass measuring 14.5 cm in greatest dimension, in the midabdomen, filling the left side and separate from the bowel; several loculations abutted the pancreatic body and tail, contents consistent with fluid.
Contrast material filled the pancreatic duct; contrast material was seen in the distal duodenum and proximal jejunum.
Persistence of fluid collection near the pancreas.
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: Patient was doing well, with no fever and a normal abdominal examination.
Patient continued to do well, with no fever or abdominal pain.
